definition[0]: to increase something such as your knowledge, experience, or range of activities
example[0]: The course helps school-leavers broaden their knowledge of the world of work.
example[1]: I’d like to work abroad to broaden my horizons  (=learn, experience, or attempt new things).
example[2]: Travel broadens the mind  (=helps you to understand and accept other people’s beliefs, customs etc).
definition[1]: to affect or include more people or things, or to make something affect or include more people or things
example[3]: Mr Mates said the party must broaden its appeal to younger voters.
example[4]: Flynn’s appeal broadened as the campaign continued into the summer months.
example[5]: I want to broaden the discussion to other aspects of the problem.
definition[2]: to make something wider, or to become wider
example[7]: The council decided to broaden the pavement.
